Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.Models.UseCaseDiagram

Class UseCaseDiagramObject

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.Models.UseCaseDiagram.UseCaseDiagramObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class UseCaseDiagramObject extends Object implements Serializable

Use Case Diagram Object

The UseCaseDiagramObject class represents individual elements within a use case diagram, specifically actors and use cases. It encapsulates properties such as type, position coordinates, and name. The class provides functionalities to render the object on a canvas, detect containment of mouse events, and manage the visibility and editing of the object's name through a text field.

This class implements Serializable to allow objects to be serialized and deserialized, facilitating saving and loading of diagrams. It also integrates with Jackson annotations to support JSON serialization, ensuring compatibility with modern data interchange formats.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-03

  • Constructor Details

    • UseCaseDiagramObject

      public UseCaseDiagramObject(String type, double x, double y, String name)
      Constructs a UseCaseDiagramObject with the specified type, position, and name.

      This constructor is used during JSON deserialization to initialize the object's state.

      Parameters:
      type - The type of the diagram object ("actor" or "usecase").
      x - The X-coordinate position on the canvas.
      y - The Y-coordinate position on the canvas.
      name - The name of the object.

  • Method Details

    • initializeTransientFields

      public void initializeTransientFields()
      Initializes transient fields that are not serialized.

      This method sets up the nameField and ensures it is initially hidden.

    • setX

      public void setX(double x)
      Sets the X-coordinate position of the object.
      Parameters:
      x - The new X-coordinate position.

    • setY

      public void setY(double y)
      Sets the Y-coordinate position of the object.
      Parameters:
      y - The new Y-coordinate position.

    • draw

      public void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Renders the use case diagram object on the provided graphics context.

      Depending on the object's type, it draws either an actor or a use case with appropriate styling. If the name field is visible, it positions the text field accordingly.

      Parameters:
      gc - The GraphicsContext used for drawing on the canvas.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(double mouseX, double mouseY)
      Determines whether the object contains the specified point.

      This method is used to detect if a mouse event occurred within the bounds of the object, facilitating interactions such as selection, dragging, or deletion.

      Parameters:
      mouseX - The X-coordinate of the point to check.
      mouseY - The Y-coordinate of the point to check.
      Returns:
      true if the object contains the point; false otherwise.

    • showNameField

      public void showNameField()
      Displays the name editing text field for the object.

      This method makes the nameField visible, allowing the user to edit the object's name.

    • hideNameField

      public void hideNameField()
      Hides the name editing text field for the object.

      This method hides the nameField, concluding the name editing process.

    • getName

      Retrieves the name of the object.

    • updateNameFromTextField

      public void updateNameFromTextField()
      Updates the object's name based on the current text in the name editing text field.

      This method is typically called when the user commits a name change through the UI.
